content.description: A good variety of face and crack climbing with some fun moves. Enjoy the views up top!Start on the face to the right of the large dihedral. Face climb for 20', continue up face/diagonal cracks or take an easier variation laybacking up the dihedral on the left. Both get to an intermediate ledge. From there move right onto the crack system to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack or trees up top for TR anchor
content.location: Start at the base of the Scaur just Right of the large dihedral going up the main face.

content.description: The Scaur is a 100ft South-facing granite wall North of Waterville Valley. It has some decent sections of rock that could use some more bolting/cleaning/traffic. Great position above the valley with views of the ski area and local peaks.
